name: Sao Paulo
hint: Largest city in South America and Brazil's financial hub

name: Buenos Aires
hint: Capital of Argentina, known as the Paris of South America

name: Lima
hint: Capital of Peru, located on the Pacific coast in a desert

name: Bogota
hint: Capital of Colombia, one of the highest capital cities in the world

name: Santiago
hint: Capital of Chile, nestled in a valley between the Andes and the coast

name: Caracas
hint: Capital of Venezuela, located in a mountain valley near the Caribbean coast

name: Quito
hint: Capital of Ecuador, situated almost exactly on the equator at high altitude

name: Montevideo
hint: Capital of Uruguay, on the northern shore of the Rio de la Plata

name: La Paz
hint: Administrative capital of Bolivia, highest capital city in the world

name: Brasilia
hint: Purpose-built capital of Brazil, designed in the shape of an airplane

name: Medellin
hint: Second-largest city in Colombia, known as the City of Eternal Spring

name: Rio de Janeiro
hint: Brazilian city famous for Christ the Redeemer statue and Copacabana Beach

name: Guayaquil
hint: Ecuador's largest city, a major Pacific port and gateway to the Galapagos Islands

name: Cali
hint: Colombia's third-largest city, known as the world capital of salsa dancing

name: Cordoba
hint: Argentina's second-largest city, a university town at the foothills of the Sierras

name: Recife
hint: Major coastal city in northeastern Brazil, called the Venice of Brazil for its waterways

name: Salvador
hint: Historic city in northeastern Brazil, the first capital of colonial Brazil

name: Fortaleza
hint: Coastal city in northeastern Brazil, known for beautiful beaches and seafood

name: Belo Horizonte
hint: Brazil's third-largest metro area, a planned city surrounded by mountains in Minas Gerais

name: Asuncion
hint: Capital of Paraguay, one of the oldest cities in South America on the Paraguay River
